name: guitar
definition: A musical instrument having a flat-backed rounded body that narrows in the middle, a long fretted neck, and usually six strings, played by strumming or plucking.
description:
The earliest form of the guitar is believed to have emerged in the 1100s, but stringed instruments have existed for at least to Babylonian times.

There are many types of guitars today belonging to both the acoustic and electric guitar families.

Acoustic guitars have a variety of parts including the body, the waist, sound hole, bridge, frets, strings, neck, fretboard, tuning pegs, and the saddle.

Electric guitars can have either a solid, semi-solid, or hollow body as they do not require a chamber to produce sound and tones.

It is typically played by strumming or plucking the strings with the right hand while fretting the strings with the fingers of the left hand.

The guitar is used in a wide variety of musical genres worldwide. It is recognized as a primary instrument in genres such as blues, bluegrass, country, flamenco, folk, jazz, jota, mariachi, metal, punk, reggae, rock, soul, and many forms of pop.

A guitarist is one who plays the guitar and Luthiers are the ones who repair and build guitars.

facts.name: Guitar strings are made of either steel or nylon
facts.value: Guitar strings are made of either steel or nylon. There can be as few as 4 or as many as 18 strings.

facts.name: The guitar is the second most commonly played instrument
facts.value: The guitar is the second most commonly played instrument. The piano is the most popular.

facts.name: The guitar pic is commonly used when playing
facts.value: The guitar pic (or plectrum) is commonly used when playing the electric guitar or acoustic guitars fitted with steel strings. Many classical guitar players only use their fingers. Pics are often made of plastic but some are also made of wood, bone, or even steel.

facts.name: The electric guitar was invented in the 1930s
facts.value: The electric guitar was invented in the 1930s once it was discovered that the amplifier could change guitar tones.

facts.name: BB King is considered a pioneer of the electric guitar
facts.value: BB King is considered a pioneer of the electric guitar in rock music.

facts.name: Antonio de Torres Jurado is father of the modern guitar
facts.value: Antonio de Torres Jurado is considered to be the father of the modern guitar known today as the classical acoustic.

facts.name: There are different guitar designs
facts.value: There are different guitar designs including the V-shaped guitar and the double neck guitar.

facts.name: Guitar types
facts.value: Guitar types include acoustic, renaissance, baroque, classical, flat top, resonator, Dobro, twelve string, acoustic bass, electric (hollow body, semi-hollow, solid body), seven string and eight string electric, and electric bass.

facts.name: The electric guitar has many of the same parts as the acoustic
facts.value: The electric guitar has many of the same parts as the acoustic guitar and a few more including the headstock, machine heads, nuts, neck, frets, fretboard, pickups, control dials, pick up switch, body, and the bridge.

facts.name: Classical guitars tend to have nylon strings
facts.value: Classical guitars tend to have nylon strings; acoustic and folk guitars tend to have steel strings; electric guitars have steel strings.

facts.name: Famous guitar players include BB King
facts.value: Famous guitar players include BB King, Jimmy Page, David Gilmour, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Jimi Hendrix, Prince, Ed Sheeran, and Robert Johnson.

facts.name: Famous guitar companies
facts.value: Famous guitar companies include Fender, Gibson, Epiphone, Gretsch, Ibanez, and Martin.

facts.name: Most guitar players use a strap to help support the instrument
facts.value: Most guitar players use a strap to help support the instrument while playing.
